row.notes: Sympathy哀哀 to the father父 and mother母 who birthed and raised you
row.jpn: 子を生み育ててくれた父母の苦労を悲しみ感謝すること

row.english: Strings tug at the heart, and winds move the soul
row.notes: Sadness哀 is evoked with stringed糸 instruments (the koto) and grandiose豪 music comes from bamboo竹 wind instruments
row.jpn: 悲しげな音を出す琴と、生き生きとした強い音を出す笛。

row.notes: Love愛 received lots多 can also hate憎 and jealousy create生
row.jpn: 愛や恩を受けすぎると、かならず人のねたみや憎しみを買うことになる。

row.notes: Peaceful安 quiet穏 and no無 issues事
row.jpn: 変わったこともなくおだやかなこと。

row.notes: Wearing the clothes衣 and crown冠 and undertaking prosperous盛 things事
row.jpn: 名門の家に生まれて勲功を立て、その家の盛んな名声を引き継ぐ者をいう。

row.notes: 束帯=formal clothing for Imperial Court; 衣冠=ordinary dress
row.jpn: 昔の貴族・官僚の礼装。

row.english: In high spirits; On cloud nine
row.notes: Spirits意気 piercing衝 the sky天
row.ant: 意気沮喪,意気銷沈,垂頭喪気
row.jpn: このうえなく意気込みが盛んなこと。

row.notes: Disposition意気 as如 one自 dictates
row.jpn: 心の持ちかたがふだんと変わらず平静なこと。

row.notes: Spirits意気 lifted揚揚 high
row.syn: 意気軒昂,意気衝天,意気昂然
row.ant: 意気銷沈,意気沮喪,垂頭喪気
row.jpn: 非常に得意で威勢のよいさま。

row.notes: 異端=fringe, outside the norm, 邪説=heresy; Also 邪説異端
row.jpn: 正統からはずれている思想・信仰・学説。

row.notes: For each一 success栄 there is an一 embarassment辱
row.jpn: 栄えたり衰えたりすること

row.notes: A一 word言 of kindness芳恩
row.jpn: ひとこと声をかけてもらったことを忘れず、感謝すること。

row.english: Teach a man to fish and feed him for a lifetime
row.notes: One一 tree樹 100百 harvests穫
row.jpn: 人材の育成は、大きな利益をもたらすこと。

row.english: A promise you can take to the bank
row.notes: Ji Bu (季布) of Western Han always made good on his word, so a一 confirmation諾 from him was considered more valuable 1,000千 gold金
row.jpn: 約束を重んじるたとえ。

row.reading: いちりょうひゃくりょう
row.english: The missing link; The key to solving a complicated problem
row.notes: When this one一 part is over了, 100百 (everything) is over了
row.jpn: 一つのことが解決すれば、すべてが解決すること。また、一つのことから万事を推測すること。

row.english: Every joy and sorrow; Experiencing an emotional rollercoaster
row.notes: A一 happy喜 moment, a一 sad憂 moment. Mood changes as the situation changes. 白熱の試合に一喜一憂する。 共に一喜一憂する。
row.jpn: 状況の変化にしたがってそのつど、喜んだり心配したりすること。

row.english: ① A warrior to rival 1,000 men. An army of one ② An exceptionally talented individual
row.notes: One一 knight騎 equal当 to 1,000千
row.jpn: 一人の騎馬兵で千人もの敵を相手にできる。転じて、一人で千人を敵にできるほど実力のあること。

row.reading: いっきゅうにゅうこん
row.english: Playing your heart out; Giving it your all
row.notes: Putting your soul魂 into入 the一 ball球. Originally from baseball, can refer to other sports
row.jpn: 悔いなき一球を投ずること。

row.notes: Once一 empty虚, once一 full実
row.jpn: いろいろ変化して、物事の予測ができないこと。

row.notes: One一 drunken酔 bout will last 1000千 days日. From a story where Liu Xuanshi (劉玄石) demands the strongest liquor there is from a shopkeeper, who gives him '1000-day liquor.' It puts Liu into a 1000-day sleep, during which he is thought dead and buried. The worried shopkeeper goes to check on Liu 1,000 days later and finds the casket. As the shopkeeper opens the lid, Liu is letting out a big yawn and has just begun to open his eyes.
row.jpn: きわめてうまい酒のたとえ。

row.notes: One一 sen銭 is 1/100 a yen, and one一 rin厘 is 1/10 that
row.jpn: わずかな金銭のこと。

row.notes: One一 placement措 of the brush, one一 stroke画
row.jpn: 漢字の一つの点、一つの画。

row.reading: いっちょうじきにゅう
row.notes: Overcoming一超 inner doubt allows direct直 entrance入 into enlightenment
row.jpn: ひとたび迷いを超越すると、にわかに悟りの境地に入ることができるということ。

row.english: To have someone wipe the floor with you
row.notes: A一 loss敗 where your guts are smeared塗 on the ground地
row.syn: 肝脳塗地,一敗地に塗る
row.jpn: 戦いに大敗すること。

row.notes: Intent意 arrives到 on the page and the brush筆 follows随 suit
row.jpn: 詩文などを作るのに、心のまますらすらと作れること。

row.notes: 陰陰=dark, gloomy; 滅滅=loss of energy. ※いん=陰, referring to Yin of Yin&Yang and darkness, not 隠 (to hide)
row.jpn: 暗く陰気で気の滅入るさま。

row.english: ① Money-obsessed ② A spoiled brat
row.notes: A Preta (starving餓 ghost鬼 of Buddhism) hungry for the possession有 of wealth財. Also, the reading is almost identical to insufferableうざい childがっき.
row.jpn: 欲が深く、金銭だけに夢中になる者のこと。

row.english: ① An exceptional skill ② A skilled professional
row.notes: Swinging運 an axe斤 and creating成 wind風. From a story about Seki, a master plasterer, who when challenged to shave plaster from a man's nose without cutting it, simply swung his axe and created a breeze that blew the paster right off.
row.jpn: 人間離れしたすばらしい技術のこと。

row.notes: It goes行 like clouds雲 across the land and spreads施 rain雨 like kindness to all
row.jpn: 雲がめぐり動いて雨が降り万物をうるおすように、天子の恩沢が広く行きわたること。

row.notes: Like clouds雲 dispersing散 or birds鳥 diving没
row.jpn: 跡形も無く消えてなくなること。

row.english: People's emotions can change at the drop of a hat
row.notes: A hand flipped翻 upward becomes a cloud雲, and a hand overturned覆 becomes rain雨
row.jpn: 世の人の態度や人情がうつろいやすいことのたとえ。

row.notes: 栄=flowers, 華=tree blossoms, 秀=fruits with no blossoms, 英=blossoms with no fruit
row.jpn: 草木の花のこと。

row.english: A hint of brilliance or hidden beauty
row.notes: 栄華=beautiful flower or brilliant light showing発 on the outside外
row.jpn: 内面にかくれている美しさやすぐれた面が表に現れること。

row.notes: Flourish栄 and decay枯, prosperity盛 and decline衰
row.jpn: 人や家などの栄えることと衰えること。

row.notes: Single単 body形 single隻 shadow影
row.jpn: 独り身で孤独なこと。

row.english: The hero wins not with brute strength, but with brains
row.notes: The hero英雄 tricks欺 the regular person人. Heroes are exceptional because they are able to think and come up with plans the average person cannot.
row.jpn: 傑出した能力をもつ人間は、すぐれたはかりごとで常人の考えがつかない手段・行動をとるものであるということ。

row.english: Trying to fit a square peg into a round hole
row.notes: Trying to fit a square方 wooden木 peg into a round円 hole孔
row.jpn: 物事がうまくかみ合わないことのたとえ。

row.english: ① Free and easy ② Smooth and refined
row.notes: (NULL)
row.jpn: 物事をそつなくとりしきるさま。

row.english: Growing long in the tooth; Getting on in years
row.notes: Extending延 your years年 and rolling転 along in longevity寿
row.jpn: 齢を重ねてますます長生きすること。

row.notes: Prince Zi (季子) of Yanling (延陵). Prince Zi, also named Jizha (季札), was the fourth and youngest son of King Shoumeng of Wu (呉王寿夢) during the Spring and Autumn Period. He was given the fuedal state of Yangling (延陵).
row.jpn: 春秋時代、呉の季札のこと。

row.notes: A lack of long遠-term thinking慮 leads to near近-term grief憂. 遠慮 means to show 'consideration' or 'reserve' by controlling immediate impulses. From Analects of Confucius: 人無遠慮、必有近憂
row.jpn: 先々のことを見通して行動しないと、身近なところに心配ごとが生じるということ。

row.notes: Measure措置 to respond応 to emergency急
row.jpn: 急場の間に合わせにする仮の処置。

row.english: ① A exercise in futility ② Unoriginal imitation
row.notes: Place架 a roof屋 above上 the roof屋
row.syn: 屋下架屋,牀上施牀,畳牀架屋,画蛇添足,頭上安頭
row.jpn: 無駄なことを繰り返すたとえ。また、真似ばかりして独創性のないたとえ。

row.notes: [Warm and gentle>温厚, [kind and honest>篤実
row.jpn: 穏やかであたたかく誠実なこと。

row.english: The gentle persuasive power of the Classic of Poetry
row.notes: Confucius used this phrase to praise the Classic of Poetry (詩経)
row.jpn: あたたかさがあり、やさしく手厚いこと。孔子が『詩軽』の教化の力を評した語。

row.notes: Having no無 pair双 within内 the Four Seas海 (bodies of water that represented boundaries of ancient China)
row.jpn: 世の中に並ぶものがないほどすぐれていること。

row.kun: 頭(こうべ)を改(あらた)め、面(メン)を換(か)う
row.english: The same thing just with a different look
row.notes: A redone改 face顔, a swapped換 out surface面
row.jpn: 表面は変わったように見えて内実は変わらないことのたとえ。

row.kun: 怪(あや)しい力(ちから)と理論を乱(みだ)す神(かみ)
row.notes: Suspicious怪 power力 and disturbing乱 spirits神
row.jpn: 人知の及ばないふしぎな現象、超自然的な物事の存在のたとえ。

row.english: A nation destroyed through internal corruption
row.notes: A river河 fish魚 with a stomach腹 illness疾
row.jpn: 国家が腐敗して、肉部から崩壊すること。

row.kun: 岸(きし)を隔(へだ)てて火(ひ)を観(み)る
row.english: Standing idly by while another suffers
row.notes: From a separate隔 shore岸, observe観 a fire火
row.jpn: 他人の災難をただ見物するだけで、救いの手をさしのべようとしないこと。

row.english: The life of a beautiful woman is destined to end in tragedy
row.notes: A beautiful佳 woman人 has an unhappy薄幸 life命
row.jpn: 美人はとかく命が短い。美人はとかく薄幸である。

row.kun: 鶏(にわとり)を割(さ)くに焉んぞ牛刀(ギュウトウ)を用いん
row.english: Using a hatchet where a scalpel would suffice
row.notes: When cutting割 a chicken鶏, you don't use a large cow牛 butchering knife刀
row.jpn: とるにたりないことを、大げさな方法で処理することの戒め。

row.kun: 下(しも)凌(しの)ぎ、上(かみ)替(すた)る
row.notes: The lower下 class rises凌, the upper上 class falls替
row.jpn: 世の中が乱れたさま。

row.notes: 緩 and 慢 represent smooth, flowing song歌 and dance舞
row.jpn: ゆるやかに歌い、ゆるやかに舞うこと。

row.english: Incredibly moved; Having goosebumps all over
row.notes: 感慨 is to feel deep in your heart. 無量 is immeasurable.
row.jpn: はかりしれないほど身にしみて感じること。

row.notes: Slowing緩 down or speeding急 up freely自在
row.jpn: 速度などを遅くしたり早くしたりして、思うままに操ること。

row.kun: 骨(ほね)を変(か)え、胎(はらご)を奪(うば)う
row.notes: Steal奪 the uterus胎 (original idea), change換 the bones骨 (structure) of a literary or artistic work. Also 脱退換骨
row.jpn: (NULL)

row.notes: A coming of age ceremony 冠, wedding 婚, funeral 葬 and festival to honor ancestors 祭
row.jpn: 慶弔の儀式のこと。

row.english: Extremely rare; The best there is, was and ever will be
row.notes: 冠前 is nothing equal ever before existing. 絶後 is nothing of the sort coming again after. Emperor Huizong of Song (宋徽宗) said there had never been an artist skilled as Gu Kaizhi (顧愷之) and there will never be another artist as skilled as Zhang Sengyou (張僧繇), but the artist Wu Daozi (呉道子) was like a combination of them both.
row.jpn: きわめて珍しいこと。

row.english: Having high respect for government work and disdain for the common people
row.notes: Respect尊 for officials官 and disdain卑 for commoners民
row.jpn: 政治や官吏・官営事業を尊び、民間人や民間事業を卑しむこと。

row.notes: Liver肝 and gall bladder胆 shine照 upon [each other>相. The liver and gall bladder represent the depth to which you understand each other and your closeness of the relationship.
row.jpn: 互いに心の底から理解しあって深くつきあうこと。

row.kun: 管仲(カンチュウ)馬(うま)に随(したが)う
row.english: Borrowing the wisdom of the sages
row.notes: Guan Zhong (管仲) follows随 a horse馬. Guan Zhong, a famed chancellor of the Spring and Autumn period, was returning home from battle and lost his way. He then releases an old horse and follows it as the horse instinctively makes its way home.
row.jpn: 聖人に知恵を借りること。

row.notes: Having one's liver肝 and brains脳 paint塗 the ground地
row.jpn: 戦場でむごたらしい死に方をすること。

row.notes: Spirit気 like a flame炎 rising 10,000万 [units of length>丈 high
row.jpn: 他を圧倒するほど意気盛んであること。

row.english: ① Mysterious and bizarre ② Outrageous and inexcusable
row.notes: 奇 and 怪 both refer to something strange with their repetition emphasizing the bizarreness of the situation
row.jpn: 常識では考えられないようなふしぎなこと。また、許せないようなけしからぬこと。

row.notes: Regulation規制 loosening緩和
row.jpn: 政府による産業や経済に関するさまざまな規制を廃止したり緩めたりすること。

row.reading: きっかいせんばん, きかいせんばん
row.english: ① Mysterious and bizarre ② Outrageous and inexcusable
row.notes: 奇怪 is strange and mysterious. 千万 is 1,000 and 10,000, large number to signify a significant level or amount of something.
row.jpn: ふだんと違っていてたいそう不気味なこと。

row.notes: Happiness喜, anger怒 sadness哀, joy楽
row.jpn: 人間の持っているさまざまな感情。

row.english: A promise in which you can place your full trust
row.notes: It is said that a一 promise諾 of Ji Bu (季布) is worth more than gold
row.jpn: 絶対に信頼できる堅い約束のこと。

row.english: Consider your own faults before criticizing the faults of others; people in glass houses shouldn't throw stones
row.notes: 脚下 refers to the base of your feet, where you stand and how you walk. 照顧 means to examine thoroughly.
row.jpn: 身近なことに気をつけるべきこと、自分のことをよく反省すべきことをいう。

row.notes: 九夏 is the 90 days of summer. 三伏 are the 3 periods in summer that are hottest.
row.jpn: 夏の最も暑い土用のころをいう語。

row.kun: 虚(キョ)にして往(ゆ)き実(ジツ)にして帰(かえ)る
row.notes: Going往 forth empty虚 and returning帰 home fulfilled実
row.jpn: 大いなる教化のたとえ。

row.english: Lacking a plan or suffering from indecision
row.notes: Like lifting挙 a Go棋 stone off the board and not不 being able to settle定 on where to place it
row.jpn: 方針をたてないまま行動すること。また、物事を行うのになかなか決心がつかないこと。

row.notes: Empty虚 self of emotion気 and calm平 the mind心
row.jpn: 心をむなしくて落ちつけること。

row.english: ① Two opponents pulling out all the stops ② Two people trying to outwit each other
row.notes: ① Literally trying to differentiate points devoid虚 of protection and points with ample実 protection on an opponent, or ② what is false虚 and what is true実
row.jpn: 互いに策略を尽くして必死に戦うこと。また、うそとまことをおりまぜて互いに腹を読みあうこと。

row.english: Blurring the lines of reality and fiction in artistic work
row.notes: Fiction虚 and reality実 indistinguishable as skin皮 and membrane膜
row.jpn: 芸術は事実と虚構との微妙な境界に成立するということ。

row.notes: Lift挙 and place措 down, i.e., actions and behavior, lacking失 appropriateness当
row.jpn: 事にあたって対応の仕方が適当でないこと。

row.notes: [Lift up>挙 and move arms, lower措 arms, move forward進 and back退. Representative of normal everyday actions.
row.jpn: 日常の立ち居振る舞いのこと。

row.english: Jack of all trades, master of none
row.notes: Many skills器用, but poor貧乏 at them all
row.jpn: 器用なためにあちこち手を出し、かえって中途半端となり大成しないこと。

row.english: Suffering from an over-abundance of options
row.notes: Philosopher Yang Zi (楊子) heard a story of a neighbor that tried to pursue a runaway sheep. During the chase, the neighbor gave up because there were too many forked岐 roads路, so he didn't know which to take and ultimately lost亡 the sheep羊. Yang Zi likened this predicament to students who pursue too many interests and fail to focus on the single path to ultimate truth.
row.jpn: 方針が多すぎて選択に迷うたとえ。

row.english: Living with frugality and working with diligence
row.notes: 謹倹 is short for 勤勉倹約, which is diligence勤勉 and frugality倹約. 力行 is putting great effort into what you do.
row.jpn: 仕事に励み、倹約し、努力して精一杯行うこと。

row.notes: A golden金 palace殿 or jewel玉-encrusted tower楼
row.jpn: 豪華できらびやかな建物のたとえ。

row.english: Using a hatchet where a scalpel would suffice
row.notes: When cutting割 a chicken鶏, you don't use a large cow牛 butchering knife刀. Usu 割鶏牛刀
row.jpn: とるにたりないことを、大げさな方法で処理することの戒め。

row.reading: くうちゅうのろうかく
row.english: Baseless or unrealistic; Lacking a solid foundation
row.notes: A tower楼閣 in中 in the sky空. Originally referred to 蜃気楼 the term for mirage.
row.jpn: 根拠のないこと、現実性に欠けることのたとえ。

row.english: Giving someone a bitter pill to swallow; Imparting harsh but needed advice
row.notes: A bitter苦 mouth口 speaking words out of concern老婆心
row.jpn: 口をにがくして教えをさとすこと。

row.notes: The Foolish愚 [Old Man>公 Removes移 the Mountains山. A Chinese fable. A foolish man lives near two mountains he finds inconvenient. He decides to move them by hand, which earns him the derision of the townsfolk. The foolish man says if he and his children and grandchildren and so on down through the ages work on it, it's not impossible. The deity Shangdi (天帝) is so impressed with the man's resolve that he removes the mountains for him.
row.jpn: 根気よくひたすら努力をすれば最後には必ず成功するというたとえ。

row.english: Even a broken clock is right twice a day
row.notes: An idiot's愚者 one一 win得
row.jpn: どんなに愚かな者でも、たまにすぐれた考えをすることがあるということ。

row.notes: Dumb愚 question問 dumb愚 answer答
row.jpn: 実りのないつまらない問答のこと。

row.notes: A group群 of light軽 things can bend折 an axle軸
row.jpn: 小さい力も数を集めれば大きいな力となるたとえ。

row.english: Better a big fish in a small pond than a little fish in a big pond
row.notes: Better the chicken's鶏 mouth口 than the cow's牛 rear後. Su Qin (蘇秦) used this allegory to recommend that the King of Han (韓王) ally with other states against the Qin秦 state instead of being absorbed into it.
row.jpn: 大きな組織に隷属するよりは小さくても人の上に立つ方がよいということ。

row.english: With crime and sin, intent is important
row.notes: There is no無 crime so small小, intentionally故 committed, that it should not be punished刑
row.jpn: 故意に犯した罪はたとえ小さな罪でも刑罰を科すということ。

row.notes: Single単 body形 single隻 shadow影
row.jpn: 独り身で孤独なこと。

row.notes: Light軽 on thinking慮 shallow浅 plan謀
row.jpn: あさはかな考えや計画。

row.english: A volume of passages with total consistency
row.notes: Blood血 vessels脈 and blood penetrating貫 through通 as a metaphor for smooth flow and consistency.
row.jpn: 一編の文章が終始一貫していることのたとえ。

row.notes: Tough堅 armor甲 and sharp利 soldiers兵
row.jpn: 堅固な鎧と鋭利な兵器。

row.notes: 権謀 and 術数 both refer to a deceptive scheme
row.jpn: 人をあざむくための策略。

row.notes: Smart賢 and good良 and correct正 in action行
row.jpn: かしこくて行いが正しいこと。

row.english: Eat like a horse and drink like a fish
row.notes: Whale鯨 drink飲 horse馬 eat食
row.jpn: 一度にたくさん飲み食いすること。

row.notes: Strike harshly激 at impurity濁 and raise揚 up purity清
row.jpn: 清潔なもの善なるものを押し上げ、汚濁のもの悪しきものを除去するたとえ。

row.notes: Well crafted巧 speech言 meant to disrupt乱 virtue徳, i.e., trick people and cause them to do bad things
row.jpn: うまくとりつくろった言葉は人を惑わしついには徳をも乱すということ。

row.english: A honeyed tongue with a heart of gall
row.notes: Well crafted巧 speech言 and servile令 mannerisms色 indicate a person of little鮮 virtue仁
row.jpn: 愛想のよいことをいったり、顔色をつくろって、人に媚びへつらうこと。

row.notes: Radiant光 brilliance彩 that steals奪 the eyes目
row.jpn: 目をみはるばかりに色どりが鮮やかで美しいこと。

row.notes: High高-level talent材 and swift疾 of foot足
row.jpn: すぐれた才能と手腕があること。

row.notes: With good好 things事, many多 demons魔 await the chance to destroy it
row.jpn: よいことには往々にして邪魔が入りやすいたとえ。

row.kun: 功(いさお)成(な)り、名(な)を遂(と)げる
row.english: Receiving high praise for one's great deeds
row.notes: Merit功 achieved成, fame名 arrives遂
row.jpn: りっぱな業績をあげて、世間から高い評価を受けること。

row.english: Extremely busy; Without a moment's respite
row.notes: Confucius' (孔子) seat席 and Mozi's (墨子) chimney突. Confucius and Mozi were two philosophers of the Spring and Autumn period. They were so busy traveling and spreading their teachings they weren't sitting at home long enough to even warm a seat or put soot in the chimney by using the stove.
row.jpn: 物事に忙しく奔走して休む暇のないたとえ。

row.english: Promoting promising new talent and removing unqualified people
row.notes: Consider考 the grades績 on the civil service exam and replace dark幽 (stupid) with light明 (smart)
row.jpn: 成績を調べて賢明な者を進め、暗愚な者を退けること。

row.reading: こうちゅうないじゅん
row.notes: Yellow黄 center中, internal内 lustre潤. Yellow is considered the central color of the Five Elements in Chinese philosophy and represents internal virtue.
row.jpn: 才能や徳を表に出さず、内に秘めていること。

row.notes: Deeds功 and virtue徳 both兼 high隆
row.jpn: 成しとげた事績と備わっている人徳とがきわめて盛んなこと。

row.notes: 黄道 is the ecliptic, or the path upon which the Sun appears move around the Earth. 吉日 is an auspicious day. Refers to days of maximum good fortune in Japanese cosmology.
row.jpn: 日がらのよい日。吉日。

row.notes: 高 and 卓 both mean high-level. 論 and 説 refer to an argument or explanation.
row.jpn: すぐれた意見や議論

row.notes: Black黒-dyed teeth歯 and tattoo carved彫 in forehead題
row.jpn: おはぐろをした歯と入れ墨をした額のこと。

row.notes: 国士 is a superb figure amazing enough to shoulder the entire nation. 無双 is having no twin, or equal. Said of Han dynasty general Han Xin (韓信).
row.jpn: 国内に並ぶ者がいないほどすぐれた人物のこと。

row.notes: A lonesome孤 struggle苦. 零丁 means to 'walk alone' and by extension wander aimlessly through life alone.
row.jpn: 身寄りがなく生活に苦しむこと。

row.english: Making a go of it on your own
row.notes: 孤軍 is a lone unit, or person without any assistance. 奮闘 is a vigorous battle.
row.jpn: 支援する者がない中で、一人で懸命に努力すること。

row.english: ① Suddenly finding a solution to your troubles ② Becoming revitalized or rejuvenated
row.notes: A dried枯 tree樹 growing生 flowers華
row.jpn: 非常な困難の中で活路が開かれるたとえ。また、老い衰えた人が生気を取り戻す。

row.english: Falling into ruin and losing one's former glory
row.notes: An empty孤 castle城 and setting落 sun日
row.jpn: 零落して昔の勢いを失い、助けもなく心細いさま。

row.english: Controlling selfish desires and following societal norms
row.notes: Subuing克 the self己 and following復 ceremonial礼 customs
row.jpn: 私欲を抑制し、社会の規範や礼儀になかった行動をすること

row.english: Struggling intensely with work or study
row.notes: 刻苦 is struggling so much you are chiseling away your own body. 勉励 is to work hard at studying.
row.jpn: 非常に苦労して、ひたすら仕事や勉学に励むこと。

row.english: Trying to cheer up or psych up someone
row.notes: Using drum鼓 and dance舞 to draw out intense激 efforts励
row.jpn: 盛んにふるいたたせ励ますこと。

row.english: An exceptional piece of writing or prose
row.notes: 孤峰 is a lone mountain peak towering above all others. 絶岸 is a sheer cliff face.
row.jpn: 文章や詩などが他より格段にすぐれているたとえ。

row.notes: Alone孤, standing立, with no無 help援
row.jpn: ひとりぼっちで頼るものがないこと。

row.english: Lacking the means to life a comfortable life
row.notes: Troubled困, suffering苦, lacking欠 and poor乏
row.jpn: 生活するのに必要な物の不足で苦しむこと。

row.notes: A beautiful佳 woman人 and talented才 man子
row.jpn: 非常にすぐれた男と女。

row.reading: さいしゅうふくしゅう
row.on: サイシュウフクシュウ
row.kun: 舟(ふね)を載(の)せ、舟(ふね)を覆(くつがえ)す
row.english: ① Just as a ruler is supported by the people, so too can he be destroyed by them ② Today's ally may be tomorrow's enemy
row.notes: Water carries載 the ship舟 but can also capsize覆 the ship舟
row.jpn: 君王は人民によって支えられ、また、人民によって滅ぼされるということ。転じて、人は味方になることもあれば、敵にまわることもあるということ。

row.notes: A tower楼閣 built on上 sand砂
row.jpn: 長続きしない物事のたとえ。また、空想するだけで現実不可能な計画。

row.notes: Three三 bindings綱, i.e., the ethics governing behavior between master and servant, parent and child, and spouses. Five五 constant常 of moral behavior: virtue, justice, manners, wisdom and trust.
row.jpn: 三つの根本的な道徳と常に行うべき五つの道。

row.english: Two heads are better than one
row.notes: Three三 people人 together can match the wisdom of Manjusri文殊
row.jpn: 一人ではよい知恵が浮かばなくても、三人が協力すればよい考えが出るものだ。

row.notes: Within the bounds of the four四 seas海 (the entire world), we are all brethren同胞
row.jpn: 世界中の人々はみな兄弟のように仲良くすべきだということ。

row.english: Words of praise for great talent
row.notes: Zijian (子建) has eight八 ladles斗 of talent. 斗 is a unit of volume also used metaphorically as a measurement of talent or character. Cao Zhi (courtesy name Zijian) was a highly-praised poet of the Three Kingdoms period.
row.jpn: すぐれた才能を賞賛した語。

row.notes: Trial試行 and error錯誤
row.jpn: 試みと失敗をくりかえしながら適切な方法を見つけること。

row.english: A warrior's spirit and merchant's talent
row.notes: Warrior士 spirit魂, merchant商 talent才
row.jpn: 武士の心と商人としての才能とを持ちあわせていること。

row.notes: Going so long without taking a [business card>名刺 out of your pocket, the rubbing against the cloth causes the characters字 to be overly漫 destroyed滅 (rubbed off).
row.jpn: 長いあいだ人を訪問しない。

row.english: Respect and humility in speech and action
row.notes: Seeing視, hearing聴, speaking言 and acting動. Show proper respect and humility in everything you do.
row.jpn: 見ること、聞くこと、言うこと、行動すること。

row.notes: Lost失 hope望, fallen落 gall胆 (represents spirit, emotional fortitude)
row.jpn: 希望を失い、非常にがっかりすること。

row.english: Sticking by someone who shows great promise
row.notes: The female雌 bird follows and lies伏 by the male雄 bird that soars飛 through the sky
row.jpn: 将来を期して人につき従い、やがて盛んに活躍すること。

row.notes: Divide分 into four四, split裂 into five五
row.jpn: ばらばらに分裂すること。

row.notes: A single一 pierce貫 from beginning始 to end終. Consistency of attitude and behavior.
row.jpn: 始めから終わりまで言動や態度が変わらないこと。

row.notes: Taking取 the good and disregarding捨 the bad to select選択 the best
row.jpn: (NULL)

row.notes: Living生 people者 will definitely必 be destroyed滅
row.jpn: 生きているものは必ず死ぬこと。

row.notes: Like a spirit神 appears出, like a phantom鬼 vanishes没
row.jpn: すばやく現れたり隠れたりすること。

row.english: Approval after the fact; Ex-post-facto approval
row.notes: Approval承諾 after後 the matter事 is over
row.jpn: 事がすんだあとで、それについての承諾をすること。また、承諾を与えること。

row.notes: Era時代 discrepancy錯誤
row.jpn: 時代の流れに合わない昔ながらの考え方。

row.english: Acting destructively out of frustration and desperation
row.notes: Damage暴 yourself自, destroy棄 yourself自
row.jpn: すてばちで、やけくそになる。

row.english: Spare the rod and spoil the child
row.notes: A merciful慈 mother母 raises a loser敗 child子
row.jpn: 教育には時には厳しさが必要なたとえ。

row.notes: 寂滅 is a term for Nirvana. 為楽 is the realization of pleasure.
row.jpn: 迷いから解放された悟りの境地に、真の安楽があるということ。

row.notes: 異端 is the fringe or outside the norm. 邪説 is heresy. Usu 異端邪説
row.jpn: 正統からはずれている思想・信仰・学説。

row.notes: Longevity寿 begets則 much多 shame辱
row.jpn: 長生きをするということは、それだけ恥をかくことも多いということ。

row.notes: Conception受胎 announcement告知. When the angel Gabriel told Mary she was going to have a baby.
row.jpn: キリスト教で、天使がブリエルが聖母マリアにキリストのみごもりを告げたこと。

row.notes: Tailwind順風 and full満 sail帆
row.jpn: 物事がすべて順調に進んでいるさま

row.english: There's precious little good in this world
row.notes: 3cm寸 of good善, but 30cm尺 of evil魔 (寸 is 1/10 of 尺, used to illustrate small/large)
row.jpn: 世の中にはよいことが少なくて悪いことが多いたとえ。

row.english: Having someone wrapped around your little finger
row.notes: Someone from whom life生 or death殺, you can give与 it or steal奪 it
row.jpn: 他のものを自分の思うままに支配すること。

row.notes: 清廉=hoenst; 潔白=pure, clean
row.jpn: 心や行いが清く、私欲や不正などまったくないさま。

row.english: A once in a lifetime opportunity
row.notes: 千載に一たび遇う。 An opportunity you meet遇 but once一 in a thousand千 years載
row.jpn: またとないよい機会。

row.english: Be the first to bear hardship and the last to enjoy comfort
row.notes: From 天下の憂いに先立ちて憂い、天下の楽しみに後れて楽しむ spoken by Fan Zhongyan (范仲淹); Prioritize先立 the suffering憂 of the world天下, then enjoy楽 the world's delights after後
row.jpn: 先に心配事・苦痛に思うことを片付け、楽しみは後回しにすること。

row.notes: Simple粗 clothes衣, simple粗 food食
row.jpn: 質素な生活・貧しい生活のたとえ。

row.english: Suffering from an over-abundance of options
row.notes: Philosopher Yang Zi (楊子) heard a story of a neighbor that tried to pursue a runaway sheep. During the chase, the neighbor gave up because there were too many多 forked岐 roads, so he didn't know which to take and ultimately lost亡 the sheep羊. Yang Zi likened this predicament to students who pursue too many interests and fail to focus on the single path to ultimate truth.
row.jpn: 方針が多すぎて選択に迷うたとえ。

row.notes: Great大 vitality胆 and without不 enemy敵
row.jpn: 度胸があって恐れ驚かないこと。

row.english: ① Natural, fluid writing ② An open and honest person
row.notes: Angel天 clothes衣 have no無 signs of being sewn縫 (no stiches or cuts)
row.jpn: 飾りけがなく自然であること。

row.notes: 平穏=peace, tranquility; 無事=nothing wrong
row.jpn: なにごともなく穏やかなこと。
